description: Transforming a New York City park into a protest operations center.
title: How Occupy Wall Street Turned Zuccotti Park Into a Protest Camp
title_page: How Occupy Wall Street Turned Zuccotti Park Into a Protest Camp - Graphic - NYTimes.com
text:
How Occupy Wall Street Turned Zuccotti Park Into a Protest Camp
Zuccotti Park, in Lower Manhattan, has been occupied since Sept. 17 by protesters in a group called Occupy Wall Street. The protesters have transformed the park into an operations center, as well as a place for some of the participants to live. The group says that it has no leaders and that major decisions are made by consensus in “general assembly” meetings. Here is how they have organized park in recent days.
